title: Appointed Festivals and Justice
summary: Deuteronomy 16 commands Israel to celebrate the major festivals: Passover, Weeks (Pentecost), and Tabernacles. It emphasizes rejoicing, remembering God's deliverance, and ensuring justice by appointing fair judges.

faq.question: What are the three main festivals Israel was to celebrate?
faq.answer: Passover, the Festival of Weeks, and the Festival of Tabernacles.

faq.question: What does Moses say about justice?
faq.answer: He says, 'Justice, and only justice, you shall pursue.'
